newsitem.title: UK: BoE's George - new regime may cut costs of low RPI.
newsitem.headline: BoE's George - new regime may cut costs of low RPI.

text.p: Bank of England Governor Eddie George said on Tuesday reforms to Britain's monetary policy structure would cut the costs of keeping inflation low.
"People will be persuaded we are really serious about inflation," he told BBC Television. "That will actually reduce the cost of achieving low inflation and that will be good for the economy."

Earlier, Chancellor of the Exchequer Gordon Brown announced he would give the Bank operational independence to set interest rates and set up a new monetary policy committee which will hold executive power.
Economists said the new regime removed the threat of rates being moved for political purposes, leaving the markets more confident that inflation will be kept under control.
That in turn could reduce the risk premium on government bonds, allowing debt to be issued more cheaply.
